abstract: Apple announced that it would no longer enforce its nondisclosure agreement for software it has released.
snippet: Apple announced that it would no longer enforce its nondisclosure agreement for software it has released.
lead_paragraph: Apple has made a core strategic tenet that it will keep information about its future plans completely obscured from public view. It was able to rewrite its entire operating system for the Intel platform in secret over several years by dividing the task up into several groups who were not allowed to communicate with each other.

headline.main: A Slice of Glasnost at Apple

abstract: The Clarion mini PC has an 800-megahertz Intel Atom processor and 512 megabytes of memory.
snippet: The Clarion mini PC has an 800-megahertz Intel Atom processor and 512 megabytes of memory.
lead_paragraph: Where haven’t PCs gone? They’re common in dens and living rooms and are even creeping into beds and onto park benches. But until the ClarionMind from Clarion, they have never colonized the automobile.

headline.main: For the Car With Everything, a Computer of Its Own
headline.print_headline: For the Car With Everything, A Computer of Its Own
